title: PEOPLE FEEDING THEIR ASSES OFF
body:
two games in a row when we lost around the 20-minute mark because someone fed their lane opponent so hard that they couldn't be fought against unless 1v5ing, and even that didnt work.

First game i had there was a bloody stupid Illaoi who fed their lane opponent yasuo and he destroyed the first turret at legit the 8 minute mark.
Tried to beat him but by then he was 12-0 and unbeatable considering I was 2-0 at level 7 and he was at level 12 already.
We lost at 18:00.

Second game we had a feeding Teemo and Sona.
The Teemo refused to leash (but the sona did) and he said he needed to be "behind enemy lines"
Got killed before we finished leashing.
Eventually, the varus and poppy destroyed the first turret and teemo was blaming it on me *mid lane yasuo* for not ganking, even tho it was yi not ganking. by then the teemo was 0/9.
This Dumbass teemo let them get the second turret 5 minutes later, and he was 0/13/0 and he was flaming me for EVERYTHING.
We lost because this varus was 23/0 cause of teemo (sona was alright though.)

replies.body: Were they feeding? Or just having a bad game? (there is a difference) No specifics here, just "they fed lane"

except for the fact that you wont get rly bad promos because they truly cant tell about how u deal with an op champ or your personal behaviour, but moreso you score at the end of the game rip support players

when you can fight illaoi in the late laning phase but just need to get a head start as not to get rekt early on (im sion btw) ask diana for gank, nah, illaoi can 2v1, SHE WAS LVL 4, AND THATS WHY IM NOT SILVER, TOO MANY SKRUBS, IM STUCK IN A DITCH

The biggest issue on this in my opinion is people not knowing when to back off.  As an example, play a bot game.  The bots can be really hard to kill, not because of complex algorithms, but instead of the simple fact that they back off when at low health.  So many players won't do this, and will instead keep going back into lane to "make up" for their deaths, and end up feeding even more.  A lost tower is a lot better than a fed opponent, and too many players don't understand this and end up making things worse than if they had just left their lane or played super safe.
